title: Eduard Štorch
text:
Eduard Štorch (10 April 1878, <a href="Ostrom%C4%9B%C5%99">Ostroměř</a> – 25 June 1956, <a href="Prague">Prague</a>) was a <a href="Czech%20people">Czech</a> pedagogue, archaeologist and writer, known for novels set in prehistoric <a href="Bohemia">Bohemia</a> during <a href="Stone%20Age">Stone</a> and <a href="Bronze%20Age">Bronze Age</a>.
Štorch was born in <a href="Ostrom%C4%9B%C5%99">Ostroměř</a>, a village near town <a href="Ho%C5%99ice%20%28Ji%C4%8D%C3%ADn%20District%29">Hořice</a>. He studied at the <a href="Gymnasium%20%28school%29">gymnasium</a> and the pedagogic institute in <a href="Hradec%20Kr%C3%A1lov%C3%A9">Hradec Králové</a>. Štorch worked as a teacher in several location in northern and eastern <a href="Bohemia">Bohemia</a> and since 1903 in Prague, during 1919–1921 as a school inspector in <a href="Bratislava">Bratislava</a> and then, until his retirement in 1938, again as a teacher in Prague.
Among Štorch's activities were <a href="archeology">archeology</a>, <a href="ethnography">ethnography</a>, <a href="biology">biology</a>, journalism and reform of education system. In 1935, together with Karel Čondl, Štorch wrote a three volumes textbook of history for secondary schools. The textbook was attacked by <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Church">catholic church</a> because it documented attempts of the church to obtain political power throughout the history.
Štorch published several scholar works, many novels for the youth and countless number of articles in journals and newspapers. The novels were based on and limited by scientific knowledge of the time. His most famous novel is ""<a href="Mammoth">Mammoth</a> Hunters"" (1918, "Lovci mamutů") set 30,000–20,000 years ago among people of <a href="Gravettian">Gravettian culture</a>. Several of the books were illustrated by <a href="Zden%C4%9Bk%20Burian">Zdeněk Burian</a>. Three novels were filmed: "Osada havranů" (1977, international title: "Settlement of Crows"), "Na veliké řece" (1977), "Volání rodu" (1978), all directed by <a href="Jan%20Schmidt%20%28director%29">Jan Schmidt</a>.
